questions.question: What is the main focus of the synthesis approach described in the text?
questions.answer: The main focus is on a direct green synthetic route based on a solvent-free methodology to construct mixed-ligand SOD Zeolitic Imidazolate Frameworks (ZIFs) that are unapproachable by pure ligand synthesis.

questions.question: How many different combinations of ligands and metal centers were explored in the study?
questions.answer: Three different combinations of ligands and three different metal centers were explored, totaling eight novel ZIFs.

questions.question: What method was used to confirm the phase purity and homogeneity of the crystals obtained?
questions.answer: X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) was used to confirm the phase purity and homogeneity of the crystals obtained.

questions.question: What was the observed ratio of ligands in the mixed-ligand samples according to 1H NMR spectroscopy?
questions.answer: An approximate 2:1 ratio in the ligands was observed in the mixed-ligand samples according to 1H NMR spectroscopy.

questions.question: Which two compounds were suitable for X-ray single crystal diffraction analysis?
questions.answer: MUV-3-mimb and MUV-3-eimb were suitable for X-ray single crystal diffraction analysis.

questions.question: What was the main counterintuitive outcome regarding the mixture of ligands?
questions.answer: The main counterintuitive outcome was that the mixture of 2-methylbenzimidazole and 2-ethylimidazole led to a material with SOD topology for all three metals evaluated.

questions.question: What did theoretical calculations predict about the stability of SOD topology upon ligand mixing?
questions.answer: Theoretical calculations predicted that the SOD topology is the lowest in energy upon ligand mixing, especially at a 2:1 ei:mb composition, in all three ZIFs.

questions.question: Is the solvent-free synthesis approach described as environmentally friendly?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: Did the study find that the mixture of ligands always resulted in the formation of SOD frameworks?
questions.answer: No

questions.question: Was the inclusion of 2-methylbenzimidazole found to increase the thermal stability of the Fe(II) structures?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: Did all mixed-ligand materials show significant N2 sorption capacity?
questions.answer: No

questions.question: Was the solvent-free synthesis method proven useful for processing the materials?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: Did the study demonstrate the ability to combine different metals in the same framework?
questions.answer: The study opened the door to potentially combine different metals in the same framework, but it primarily focused on creating multivariate ZIFs with different ligand combinations.

questions.question: What was the role of theoretical calculations in the study?
questions.answer: Theoretical calculations were used to assess phase stability and predict the most stable phases for each pure-ligand ZIF, as well as the effect of ligand mixing on the stability of SOD topology.

questions.question: Did the study find that the gate-opening capacity of ZIFs could be modified by using mixed-ligand frameworks?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: Was the study successful in creating multivariate ZIFs with network complexity?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: Did the study's findings suggest that the solvent-free synthesis could be scaled up for commercial use?
questions.answer: The study highlighted the facile applicability and environmental friendliness of the solvent-free approach, suggesting potential for scaling up, though it did not explicitly discuss commercial scalability.

questions.question: Was the combination of 2-methylimidazole and 2-ethylimidazole with Fe(II) found to form a SOD framework?
questions.answer: No, in the case of a mixture of 2-methylimidazole and 2-ethylimidazole with Fe(II), a qtz framework with only one of the ligands (2-ethylimidazole) was obtained.

questions.question: Did the study provide insights into modifying the physical properties of ZIFs through mixed-ligand frameworks?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: Was the study able to control the final ratio of ligands in the mixed-ligand samples by adjusting the proportion in the synthesis?
questions.answer: Yes, the study was able to slightly modify the final ratio of ligands by adjusting the proportion in the synthesis, finding an upper limit of ca. 70% and a lower limit of ca. 50% for 2-ethylimidazole and 2-methylimidazole, respectively.
